history.content:
FWIW I was told not to take 2 technical over summer. But I took it either ways , in my 11th grade summer . I took 61A and Data C8 as I also had good programming background . Data C8 cannot be compared to CS70 from a complexity perspective.

As I am currently taking CS70 I can attest to the difficulty of this course inspite of taking Discrete Math at local Community college.

It will take some time and discipline but doable with your background.

children.subject:
<md>> quite a few people saying it’s not doable
they are most likely wrong</md>

Depends on how you define doable. If you want to have a decent and relaxing summer while taking them then probably no, but if you are ready to bash your head against the wall for 8 weeks then yes. I took 61b+data100 and got pretty good grades (to be fair they were pretty lenient on grading), but I wouldn't say it was enjoyable or even healthy, mentally and physically. So my suggestion is unless you have reasons that you really want to do it, maybe consider something else.

Look at publicity available past notes and take a past exam from CS 70. Are you comfortable with the material? Do you have a solid foundation in math (discrete math, manipulating variables with proofs) or probability? You can do the same with CS 61A (familiarity with python, control structures, recursion, trees are all big topics) and get a feel on how you feel about the course, then come to your own non-biased honest conclusion on how comfortable you feel about the two courses and make a decision from there.

history.content:
I am considering the plan above but saw quite a few people saying it’s not doable.
Since I had coding experience, tried projects of 61A like Hog and Cats and I knew that exams are the most challenging part of 61A, I am wondering if this “not-doability” is not defined that strictly, which remains room of freedom for people with backgrounds like me.

Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Why it’s not doable to take 61A and 70 over summer? Need detailed explanations
